extendedInfo.description: Remote & TV Guide by SonyTV SideView is an entertainment application that you can operate Sony home devices easily and actively to enjoy TV and contents through smartphone or tablet device.-Convenient remote control-TV Guide on your hand-Seamless search from TV to onlineFor existing Media Remote app users, TV SideView app will offer additional functionalities in addition to being able to control Sony home devices.- Compatible device listSony LCD TV BRAVIAXBR-X90xA seriesXBR-84X900/84X905XBR-HX950/HX955/HX957XBR-HX920/HX925/HX927/HX929KD-X900xA seriesKD-X920xA PlayerSMP-N100,  SMP-N200,  NSZ-GS7,  NSZ-GX70Sony Internet TVNSX-24GT1,  NSX-32GT1,  NSX-40GT1,  NSX-46GT1,  NSZ-GT1Sony AV ReceiverSTR-DN1020,  STR-DN1030- Key features1. Enjoying TV more: You can get details on the program you are watching on TV or disc etc. (like information on crew, cast, or synopsis), and also see what people are tweeting about.2. Easily find media content across various services or devices: You can search from TV program guide, home network, Video Unlimited, Music Unlimited, YouTube, Netflix, websites, applications and recorded programs on BRAVIA.3. Send a message about TV programs and movies you are watching to social network sites via your smartphone or tablet device.4. Others  - Remote: Use almost the same button layout as you would have on an actual remote control.  - Keyboard: Easier typing using the full QWERTY touch-screen keyboard.  - Free cursor: Enjoy more control of the free cursor with free pointing.- Additional information1. âTV SideViewâ will work only if your mobile device and your home device are connected to the same wireless network.2. Some functions and services may not be supported by certain home devices.3. Some functions and services may not be supported in certain regions/countries.4. The seamless link to services such as YouTube etc., is subject to change or termination without notice.

reviews.title: Excellent utility
reviews.comment: Removes the need to keep the remote around and provides all button functionality on screen. Built in program guide with button to instantly take you to a TV program is also great. Well built, valuable application.
reviews.author: Matt Blubaugh

reviews.title: Rodent work have to up grade
reviews.comment: I have a 42 inch Sony bravia LCD TV plus I have a Sony internet/ bluray player n and a ps3 none are on list. And I don\'t think I\'m about to go n up grade. To newer TV ,blu ray or ps3 that would be pretty materailistic of me TV is less than 3 yrs old n bluray is Only 2 yrs ps3 is still under warrenty neat invention but I think ill stick to my TV, blu ray n ps3 I have now. Sorry Sony I can\'t afford to  upgrade my intier entertainment center in the middle of a ression.
reviews.author: Amy Ludwig

reviews.title: No PS3 support!
reviews.comment: This is kind of dumb for it to be advertised on my PS3 and then I get it thinking \"Why would it be on my PS3 if it didn\'t work with it?\" Yeah, it doesn\'t work with it though.
reviews.author: Jason Kerkvliet

reviews.title: Hmm
reviews.comment: Got this app bc i lost my remote for my blu ray player. Player shows up on the device list, but has to be registered...using the original remote. Aw shucks.
reviews.author: Jessica Klein

reviews.title: Doesn\'t support ps3
reviews.comment: Why does this not work with the ps3?  Why would you spend time to advertise it on the ps3 and it not be compatible.   That seems just a little stupid if you ask me.
reviews.author: Russell Thruston

reviews.title: Sony FTW like always
reviews.comment: If you haven\'t learned by now Sony products only work the way they should when everything you own is Sony.. I have a Sony Xperia Ion Sony Bravia 46\" led 3D 240Hz PS3 Custom gaming PC Sony gaming headphones Sony cameras  E.T.C I have been able to share content across my SONY devices for YEARS now wayy before this amazing app was created  It costs to have a proper set up yes but the cost is worth every dime when you can push HDR pics wirelessly from your phone to your 3D tv WITHOUT THIS APP
reviews.author: Ollie Mulvany

reviews.title: Really
reviews.comment: No support for the Bravia KDL XX NX810 You\'ve got to be kidding me right.  This app is useless to me, uninstalled right now!!!
reviews.author: Joe Schmo

reviews.title: No \"watch\" option
reviews.comment: Everything is connected, the remote control aspect works but there is no \"watch\" button on the guide which was the main feature I wanted. I don\'t understand why the official sony app can\'t tune to a channel but other apps like buddyTV can. Also manually having to add the remainder of my cable package to the guide is tedious as there is no check all option and it defaults to a small list of channels. The limit on channels that you can toggle should not exist either, I can\'t add all the channels I get.
reviews.author: Dave Tanquary

reviews.title: Licence Loading Error
reviews.comment: Horrible.. I\'ve got the same app on my ipad.. it works.. on HTC One it can even not load the licence agreement.. I couldn\'t use it at all.. please fix this..
reviews.author: Tankut T\303\274may

reviews.title: This Rocks
reviews.comment: I RECENTLY bought Sony home theater & Sony Bravia tv before installing this app if had hear any music from Hard disk connected to blue ray player i had to switch my TV on & select my music but now after having this excellent app i can do it from any where in home. so keep this app updating sony .
reviews.author: N.Krishna kanth

reviews.title: Maybe
reviews.comment: This would have been a great app if I was able to connect it to my PlayStation. ..
reviews.author: Mike Soto

reviews.title: Completely useless...
reviews.comment: The controls are limited, abysmally, the interface e can be confusing, the number of devices supported is minuscule (it doesn\'t even support the PS3), and it doesn\'t even have landscape mode!!! Terrible!!!
reviews.author: Devin Cassidy

reviews.title: No compatibility for the latest Sony TVs!
reviews.comment: Disappointed that it\'s almost September and the app doesn\'t support the latest Sony TVs that came out earlier this year (R550 series).  When will support be added for these 2013 models?
reviews.author: J DiGeorgio

reviews.title: GARBAGE
reviews.comment: I don\'t even know how to connect it to ps3 ......I\'M OUT
reviews.author: Jafari Burrell

reviews.title: Works Great Since Player Update
reviews.comment: I used this app to stream YouTube from my phone to the the tv, and it would constantly play several seconds then jump back a few, then play forward more, then jump back throughout whatever video I was watching.  Since the most recent bluray player update, it plays the YouTube videos from my phone all the way through with no hiccups.  And the video Que is nice to set up a bunch of videos to play one after another.  Hope the app continues to work fluidly because I\'m happy with it right now.
reviews.author: Stephen Mitchell

reviews.title: Droid Razor Max
reviews.comment: Love this app... Use it mainly for the tv guide in my area,  but I love it that it\'s also a remote for my google tv box!
reviews.author: Den Jenkins

reviews.title: Crap
reviews.comment: My Sony TV doesn\'t show up and the design of the app is fugly. The 1 star is for the programme that is great although no use without TV registering! Old remote app was crap as well. Sony is a huge company. Invest in someone to design u good apps please!
reviews.author: Damian Clarkson

reviews.title: Fairly pointless
reviews.comment: One problem with Sony is that they ditch support for products very quickly, so if your other Sony products are anything other than box fresh then there\'s little chance of getting this app to work with them. It\'s still marginally useful though, but frankly not worth the effort for most people.
reviews.author: Conrad Longmore

reviews.title: Bad
reviews.comment: Really? Requires a net connection but the built in app on my Galaxy 4 does not, then finds neither my tv or blu ray.
reviews.author: Mark Longfellow

reviews.title: Why?
reviews.comment: This program was advertised on my PS3. I\'m unhappy to learn I cannot use it to control one of the main Sony devices. My PS3! Seemed like a cool idea but it\'s just a fail if you don\'t have certain Sony devices it\'s just worthless! Needs some rethinking.
reviews.author: Matthew Twiggs
